intro: Douglassia, commonly known as broadleaf arrowhead, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Alismataceae. It consists of several species native to the eastern United States and parts of Canada. The plants are characterized by their broad, arrowhead-shaped leaves and are typically found in wetland environments. Douglassia species are herbaceous perennials that often grow in shallow water or moist soil. They play an important ecological role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
